messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: school
messages.msgSnippet: That may be Kawaji, not Kouchi ?, is that on the paper, it is not in the mei. There were many families or lines in the Choshu school, I have not heard of
messages.messageBody:
That may be Kawaji, not Kouchi ?, is that on the paper, it is not in the
mei. There were many families or lines in the Choshu school, I have not
heard of Kouchi as a family. It looks like on the paper, above the
Nagato Kuni Ju, it says Kawaji Den or Ha, but it is too hard to make
out. I would post the kanji here but it never works for me.

Cheers

Rich

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] school
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Jon, that is Choshu, not Soshu, the image is a tad small but I can see Nagato Kuni saku on there. It also note it is late Edo. In Haynes is states Choshu
messages.messageBody:
Hi Jon, that is Choshu, not Soshu, the image is a tad small but I can
see Nagato Kuni saku on there. It also note it is late Edo. In Haynes is
states

Choshu Hagi Ju, Nagato province, D: ca 1800. Some say this is the same
artist as Bushu Ju Masasada. He signed Bushu Ju, Kofu Ju and Buko Ju,
Wakayama says he is the same man as Choshu Ju. Akiyama Kyusaku in the
TOKEN KAI-SHI part 97, Oct. 1908 says this name is unrecorded, at that
time, and he did good work.

There are mei references in the Church Collection and Toso Tosogu Meiji
Taikan book 3 page 240

Cheers

Rich

http://ph.groups.yahoo.com/group/nihontostudy/photos/view/d020?b=8

Above is the URL for a tsuba signed 'Soshu (no) Ju Masasada' It is said
to have been made by a metalworker of the Kouchi school in Nagato no
Kuni. Does anyone have info about this school? John
